column1: The only issue I have is that I was driving it in very hard rain and the car slid quite a few times even while driving slowly.
The overall look and feel of the vehicle.
It's a great car.
I love this car, but I wish it had a more quiet ride.
Seats and smooth ride

I have owned several Nissan vehicles and have always recommended them to friends and family.  I love Tom Peacock - we always get a better deal and better customer service than other dealerships we have visited.

I don't feel anything can be done about how I feel. It is a beautiful car. I just don't like some things about it. Wish I had researched more and comparing to my previous vehicle, I miss the car I traded in. I probably would not purchase this vehicle again.
Warranty, audio system. Cruise control is great. Comfort.
It has a lot of bells, my opinion is based on personal feelings so I wouldn't want to dissuade anyone from purchasing if they like it

For the price the Murano is a beautifully designed car.  The navigation system is exceptional. Owning two Mercedes Benz vehicles, I find this product to be a good buy for the family member and i am sure it will give them the feeling of driving in class.  The voices used in the car are very clear and the space to the rear is especially good for what we need it for.  I have usually purchased upper level cars like Mercedes, Lexus and Cadillac  but for the price, this is a great product and something for one to consider.  I look forward to many years of service.  I might recommend that you offer 4 years of oil changes with the vehicle like some other car companies are doing namely or 3 years to coincide with your warranty.  This would be a great selling point with people knowing they would not have to put any money out for three years and might be a reason why they would want to trade every three years.
The navigation system.
For the money it is a good looking vehicle and I believe would service the people very well.  Again love that nav system.

Not sure where to move the steering wheel computer buttons but I don't like them there.  The doors are very heavy and I have trouble getting the door to stay open when I get out.  It's always closing on me :-).  A wider color selection would be nice too.  I know I saw a dark wood grain interior in a car at a car show but when we purchased our car it wasn't available but I loved the car and we purchased it anyway.

Its a beautiful car -- the inside cabin lighting makes it look very elegant in the evening.  It works well and over all it works great.  I'm still having issues with how everything works (the computer functions) but its nice to have them all available.
Computer learning curve.
It seems to me that the shock absorbers and stiffness of  the tires are more    evident than on my previous Quest van.   The tire pressure is  correct.
I love the safety features, blind side warning indicators.  I feel more safe.
This is my third Nissan in succession and I have had excellent service from all   so far. I believe Nissan to be very reliable products.

Add back up radar warning system and rain sensor wipers.
Emergency braking system and cruise control warning system  are great. heated steering wheel  is a wonderful feature. Seats are very comfortable which is good for long trips.

The Murano has excellent safety technology emergency braking systems and is very easy to drive and park. The mileage is good,  pick up is good, and seats are comfortable.  The selection screen is user-friendly and dashboard controls are easily accessible.

It's my wife's vehicle and the most important thing to me is that she is happy with it. We purchased it over the Honda Pilot and the Toyota Highlander ONLY because she has a bad hip and she was most comfortable in this vehicle.

I have purchased over 30 new vehicles in my life. There are many good products in the market. I was very happy with my Altima but only keep it for a few years. We plan to keep this vehicle 10 years. Ask me the same question 10 years from now and based on the reliability of the vehicle and the service received from the dealer that number could go up or down. You should send this survey out at intervals such as one year, perhaps when the vehicle is pad off ect.

We previously owned a Murano and wanted another and haven't been disappointed. The one thing I've noticed, are the controls on the steering wheel for the audio system. The buttons are on the down side of the arm of the wheel and are inconvenient, not a huge issue.

My biggest disappointment is that we were told by our salesperson that the Nissan App would work in this vehicle and having the ability to use the app to remote start from a distance was a huge "want" of mine and one of the reasons this car was purchased.  Only after the sale was final did I find out that the app was not available on this model.  That disappointment has clouded my opinion and buying experience overall.
The styling of the body and color of the interior.

My previous comment answers the rating received.  My heart was set on the app being available and since it isn't, I am disappointed overall.  I specifically asked the salesperson if that app was available and was told yes, he even downloaded the app on  my phone, only to find out after the purchase, it was not available.  I maybe wouldn't recommend the dealership vs a Nissan in general, but have no experience with any other Nissan dealership.
Great vehicle, no complaints
Gas mileage, the ride, and love the sunroof.
Just love everything about it, and it looks great.

Interior lighting could be brighter. When pull to mailbox after dark and activate interior light to see, it's to dark to tell what's right outside door. Guess this is personal preference but last vehicle gave off enough light to see.
Quite ride on highway.
Limited warranty. Nissan should stand behind their vehicles for at least four years.

I am used to more power when entering the highway. I expected more get up and go with a 6 cylinder opposed to my 4 cylinder. My husband says it sounds like the engine is struggling to keep up the amount of speed to get on the highway. Like a bunch of squirrels working their asses off on a stationary exercise wheel.  Sorry for the reference, but it's pretty accurate.
No power getting on the highway.
A much better entertainment/navigation/bluetooth/phone-txt system and experience.  What is in the car "looks" good but performance is poor at best.
Love the look, seats and driving experience.
The vehicles technology interface, which is so vital for work and entertainment these days, is poor at best.
Already mentioned the problems.
The style outside.
It needs to have the items I mentioned changed for the better before I would give it a higher rating.

Fix the dimness of the dash instrumentation which I mentioned before. If I get a warning in the daylight, chances are great I'll not be able to see it. I should be able to see the digital display on the dash as easily as I can see the map on the navigation system. Honestly, this is the biggest negative I have with this car. Drivers should be able to see those functions in broad, bright sunlight and I'm sure you would agree

Interior appearance surpasses any other brand in its class   I have the white/light interior and that was the one thing I would not budge on when choosing my vehicle. Don't care for the gray or black interiors. Would like to see Nissan expand this option to other exterior colors

Not my first Nissan. Had a Rogue before. Traded from a Mercedes and while you can't compare directly the two brands, Nissan came closest to pick up responsiveness when I needed it changing lanes, etc    I miss the sound system in the Mercedes and the CD function which allowed me to upload cd's so they didn't have to be stashed in the car.  Really a single CD for. a Murano Platinum with all the bells and whistles???? You guys can do better than that.

I love my new Murano. It's exactly what I wanted and it's a beautiful vehicle. I'm adjusting to the mpg's as I had a car prior to the Murano. Exceptional handling in the Colorado winter! I'm very satisfied!
It's beautiful and it handles exceptionally well in bad weather.

The staff at Valley Nissan was exceptional! Thank you Michael! My Murano is a beautiful and safe vehicle roomy enough for a family or to haul a purchase. I fit a 91/2 foot rug and a wing chair in the back of my Murano! Incredible room and a quiet cabin.
This is my forth Nissan and I am very very pleased with my purchase. I brings back excitement in driving again. I love my Murano.
Nissan to me is quality.

A hood redesign or some non reflective material put on the bend at the windshield end. Adjust the transmission response to engage with lower engine rpm. Install seatbelt adjuster at pillar so a lower belt position is available. Install additional panel light in rear storafge compartment.
Comfort overall is quite fine and has many fine interior features.Vehicle has a good high seating position for driver. Vehicle is relatively quiet and has comfortable ride.
Because of the shortcomings I have identified previously and the cost of vehicle relative to budget levels of friends.
Due to the trouble I had in the beginning, I now live with the fear of having bought a lemon. The car handles very nicely and I love the look, hope the engine lives up to the rest of the car.
How the car handles and how comfortable is to drive.

I had a 2010 Murano that was a very reliable and the reason I bought the 2017 Murano. I never expected to have trouble right after my purchase of the 2017 Murano. Hopefully my difficulty in the beginning was just a fluke and will prove to be just as reliable as my prior Murano.
Though vehicle is relatively quiet , could be a bit more in my opinion

Love all the features,touch screen,voice recognition hands free. Heated as well as cooled seats. Interior is beautiful color combination very luxurious  rear reclining seats push button for seats to fold down and pull back up space inside is very roomy  overall truly love this vehicle
Have driven as well as driven inside numerous nissan vehicles.  Like overall quality and longevity of the products

My biggest complaint is the rattle with the sunroof ... but I havent taken it in yet, because honestly I do not want to deal with the dealership.  My car was over a week late in delivery, no one could tell me where the car was but they were all happy to take my money for it.  I was promised $600.00 off the sticker price for the trouble and payment of my first loan payment ($541.00) by Nissan - neither of these promises were fulfilled.  The sales manager at Priority Nissan and the finance manager will not return my phone calls or emails.  This has truly lessoned experience.  I really do love my car, but this overall experience has been dreadful.

it drives wonderfully, it is spacious and comfortable.  it is exactly what i wanted.  The only caveat was that the 2017 Nissan Murano's have the Apple Car feature, which mine did not come with  - that was a real bummer to be honest.

due to the delivery experience and the lack of care for the customer that the sales manager at Priority Nissan showed.  He blamed my experience on Nissan as a company and did not take any ownership in the problems I had.  Because of this and the lack of response I have received from any one - I cannot recommend a company or dealership that treats its customers that way.  As much as I love my car, if I had not already paid for it, I would have bought a Kia.

Interior.

For the price, there are a LOT of missing items. 1. ability to set doors to auto lock when I get out after 15 seconds. 2. When playing music from USB, start where you left off, not all the way back to the beginning every time. (irritating)  3. Don't make me turn on cruise button every time I start car!  Just leave it on and allow me to just hit the set button.  4. Can't speak a text message - all canned msgs.  5. Navigation does not auto route based on traffic.  6. Boes sound system is just ok.  Does not sound that great.  Don't get me wrong, there are a lot of positives too!  Great look, 20" tires, smooth/quiet ride.
Look, smooth/quiet ride, 20" tires.  The interior look sold me on this car.  I loved the ivory interior with the white woodgrain look.  Love the remote start.

Because of all the things I mentioned and the warranty is just average.  Best in class is 100K miles.  I don't put enough miles on a car to be out of warranty after 3 years.  Also the same day I purchased car, I changed my mind and cancelled the extended warranty and maintenance pgm.  2 1/2 months later I still have not been reimbursed $4080.00.  Have called Finance Mgr 3 times and no return call to date 2.2.17

It is one of the most advanced technological cars, as well as beautiful...and it does not cost as much as, say, the 'Infinity', which is a Nissan product too, and you end up paying much more just for the name. We know, as we had an Infinity for years.

This is my second Murano - my first was a 2009 and the 2017 is beautiful and I love it!  I have commented to friends and family that I do not know how Nissan could top this years model.  The Artic Blue is such a beautiful color, the lines look so good and the graphite interior sets it off.  I have found all Nissan's fit you like a glove when you sit or ride in one.
The color, technology, braking if you get to close, blind spot indicators, overall cameras, I can go on and on.

I love my Murano! It drives more sportier than my Lincoln but is a nice ride. It would be nice to be able to text by voice command via an iPhone 6 or greater. The car system appears to offer this feature and it should work. This may be a carrier issue but this needs to be worked out at the manufacture level so as to be a safety feature. As of now, I pull my phone out and use Siri because the car system will not even send one of the predefined texts.
I Love the overall sportiness of the Murano. I LOVE the cockpit!!

Overall I believe the Nissan Murano is a great vehicle for most people who are interested. Fix the text and phone connectivity and offer more apps, and then I will give a 10. A 9 is good in my opinion at this point.

In regard to the storage I don't see a lot being able to be done. If you add more space to the back then you would be taking away from the roominess of the backseats. I would rather my passengers be comfortable and just have to pack creatively than to give that up. As for the radio I just think the speakers are average. I actually felt my speakers in my Dodge Neon produced a better and louder sound.

It's hard for me to pick one thing. I think it is a very classy looking car both inside and out. It's a very smooth and quiet ride. I love how sturdy the car feels when I drive it or when I am the passenger. I also love how comfortable it is. It is roomy and the seats are very comfortable. It's just really an all around nice car and I'm very pleased with my purchase.

It's two fold for me. In regard to my car and how it handles and looks I couldn't be happier and I would recommend this particular car to others. My niece leased the Rogue a few months earlier and she loves her car too. As I said previously, it's a classy looking car but still sturdy and it handles really well. It's something I feel comfortable taking my customers out in because of the quality of the car both in looks and safety. The other reason I would recommend Nissan is because of the way the sale was handled. The two people I worked with never made me feel like I was being strong armed into anything. The gentleman (I can't remember if his name is PK or KP) was a good salesman in that he was able to push the sale along and keep me interested but he did it in a way that was more of a fun banter and not an aggressive, irritating pushy way. I went to Kia as well and I was actually pretty set on buying the Sorento. But my experience at Kia was terrible. They wanted to run my credit before they would even give me an idea of what numbers they could work with. I refused, walked out of the dealership, and went to Nissan and bought my car. I won't work with people that treat me that way when I am spending that much money with them. And Nissan didn't do that to me. Also, the only reason I had considered checking out Nissan is because I liked how KP (PK?) and Maylan treated my niece during her transaction. It's what brought me to the Premier Dealership on Capitol Expressway to look at other cars. I hadn't even considered buying a Nissan until I went with her for her transaction. So good sales people that are respectful and treated me like a customer should be treated and a beautiful car. You can't beat that.

I have only had my Murano two months and am still getting acclimated to the various functions and technological features.  So far, I have no complaints or recommendations to make.  But, if something occurs going forward, I'll let you know.

One of my most favorite features is the automatic liftgate.  My upper arm strength isn't the greatest, so this is a truly valuable feature for me.  Also, now that I'm becoming accustomed to it, the ability to communicate via my cell phone through the car's dashboard is fantastic!!  The safety features, like the intelligent cruise control are wonderful (still getting adjusted to that) and the side, front and rear proximity indicators are very useful in high traffic situations.  It's a smooth and quiet ride and the interior is quite comfortable for my family.

With all of the comforts and safety features in my Murano, I'm recommending it to family and friends who are looking for a vehicle with these good quality items.  The folks whom I've taken for rides in the Murano are all impressed with the overall features and the interior/exterior appearance.  I'm highly satisfied with my choice and, as time goes on, am looking forward to an ongoing wonderful driving experience with my Murano.

It's a stunning vehicle, inside and out - the annoyances I've experienced are not earth shattering...just nit picky things because the rest of the vehicle is so stunning.  If the navigation could be programmed to show ETA (rather than travel time to destination) it would be much more helpful.  I don't want to calculate my ETA while driving...I want to look once and see if I'm late or on-time.  Light on heated/cooled seats should be red/blue like the Ford system.  Nissan apps are worthless, connectivity to the system is a joke, and there are very few offerings.  In a technology driven world, this needs to improve or Nissan is going to be left behind.  Cheaper Chevy and Ford models have superior technology interface.

I really like the Murano. Its interior and exterior styling are outstanding. The sound system feels mediocre compared to other vehicles I've owned, considering it's the Platinum model. Also, there's no oil life/change indicator, and you can't add a destination in Nav once the vehicle is moving, which is an annoyance when you have a passenger at the controls.
Very smooth ride, its aesthetics, and the safety features (blind spot indicators, brake assist).

Thinking about what you get with the Platinum model versus comparable features on luxury brands, I think it's a great value. But I haven't owned my vehicle long enough to rate it on overall reliability and value. Ask me at 3 years/100,000 miles. :)

Of all the vehicles I have owned I found the Nissan model I have owned to be very reliable, great handling and very responsive vehicles.  I have always their their interior and exterior design to be very pleasing.

Nissan needs to consider offering more options for interior colors. I chose the light tan color (cloth) because I truly hate black interiors and exteriors. Black is the only other option on the Murano. PLEASE consider offering a light to medium gray, and not solid color but cloth with other hues mixed in. That color scheme does not show dirt as badly as very light or very dark colors. I don't buy cars very often, so I am stuck with the light color interior of my Murano for years. I am getting used to it, but it is quite hard to keep clean with grandkids climbing in and out, etc.

It handles very well and is easy to drive. I like the advanced electronics, especially the tire pressure readings, mpg indication, and navigation system. Although I will probably not have the navigation system updated. I already own two portable navigation units that are updated FREE every month, so I will not be paying the $100-$200 robbery fee dealers charge to update built-in navigation. All auto companies should be ashamed of that ridiculous fee.

I have experienced that at 1000 RPM the transmission is noisy and there is a vibration...the noise and vibration cease as soon as the transmission is below or above 1000 RPM. Also, in this day in age of electronic transmission shifting, WHY are you still taking up large amounts of console space with an out of date, large shifter?  I owned a 1964 Chevy Corvair in the 60's that had the transmission shifter on the dash.  Since the transmission shifting is now electronic, why should it take up a third of the console space? I was disappointed with some of the items that were removed from the 2017 versus the 2015.  I purchased the same level platinum all wheel drive but added the moon roof and the enhanced safety package.  The 2017 does not have the lit (Murano) kick plate that the 2015 had.  The gas mileage is not as good.  The road noise is more notable.  I had the issue with the rattling bracket ( it was so noticeable that I do not know how it was allowed out of the factory).  The headrest is a concern because it will not adjust but currently meets my wife's requirements.  I did not have any of these types of issues with the 2015.  I am concerned that some of these items are due to cost saving actions by Nissan.  As noted above they are noticed by the end item consumer.

(That and a McLaren F1 or a Bugatti Veyron, but they are a wee bit out of my price range)

The issues I've had with my Murano are slight.  The company has a fantastic reputation and out of the last four vehicles we've had, we've had very, very little to complain about.  No major issues at all.  In fact, when I bought my first Rogue, Nissan said they had heard that people were concerned about the, new at the time, Continuously Variable Transmission.  They extended my warranty to stand behind the vehicle.  That won my respect.  My husband drives a Pathfinder and loves it - though he wishes the new ones had not changed from the truck platform.  Overall Nissan has our loyalty

There is very little storage right next to the driver. I am a woman and carry a purse. If there is someone in the passenger seat, I have to put my purse in the back seat which make it tough to access if I need to get something out (e.g., sunglasses or cash). I feel just a bit claustrophobic in the drivers seat.    Larger gas tank. I feel like I am always filling up.    The design of the hood, with the bend down right next to the windshield, reflects the sun right in my eyes if the sun is at just the right angle. I do not care for that design feature.

Smooth ride (ride, shifting, braking). Love the smart cruise control that slows down if you get too close to the car in front of you. Really love the blind spot warning - it has already saved me a few times!

First, I would not buy a vehicle with an all black interior again.  It is hot in the summer in Minnesota.  And it gets really dusty.  The quality of the materials is outstanding though.  And, I would be sure the driver's seat would have a tilt feature (Forward, higher, then tilt the front down).  My friend, who is tall and heavy, was super impressed with the generous size of the seats.  I think the 2017 Murano is really exceptional overall.

The large screen, the surround vision and the lines of the parking lot so I know I am not too close to the other cars.  Other people tell me "I wish I had that !"  I suppose this sounds fussy, but I liked the front of my Jeep better.  The front actually goes over the curb onto sidewalks and interferes with walking area.  I prefer a boxier front.  Where there is curb and grass going uphill the front hits the grass so the vehicle  has to back up a bit and then stick out in the back.  But the looks of it can't be beat.  I have had people walk around it in the parking lot and I can tell they are impressed.  It is a fancy looking vehicle.  Mine has a lot of chrome.  I have always liked the Nissan taillights.

I am disappointed in the internal storage compared to my last 2 Muranos.  1. no small space under the dash on the center console for quick things like pen, chap stick etc.    2. the Center bin does  not have the small tray that could be accessed instead of the large bin.  Now there is just the large bin (with smaller capacity) making things like reading glasses, mints change harder to keep organized.  3. the door compartments are smaller and things fall out of them easily.  My 2007 Murano had a "pop out" feature making it much easier to get to things in the door. That was gone in the 2013 and missed it.  4. Small drawer behind the center console is gone.  Not a big deal for me but still was a nice feature.  5. the eye glass holder on the roof is a little smaller then the 2013.  6. Glove compartment is narrower then last one.  the 2013 was GREAT!  Kept a folder in there with necessary paper work, Handicap placard for Mom...etc.  Folder no longer fits.    Overall....I love my new Murano!  As I said, this is my 3rd and I will continue to buy Muranos despite the above statements.  They are just nuisance items.

It's hard to get a clear view if any traffic is coming from the right. 2) I know it's a safety feature but I wish I didn't have to push the door unlock button to let people out of the car between the time that I put the car in park and shut off the ignition.  Perhaps there is a way to turn this feature off that I haven't found.

I think this is an excellent car, but there are a few things that would make it better, especially with the cost of the car. Rain sensing wipers would be a nice feature. I've had this in other similar priced vehicles. "Puddle" lights that illuminate on the exterior when nearing the car at night. Audible beeping sound when backing up or pulling into a parking space. The camera view is great, but having an audible beeping would make this feature even better. Cruise control that doesn't have to be turned on every time the car is started. Also, it would be an improvement if the following distance for the adaptive cruise control could be configured and saved in settings rather than having to set it every cruise control is turned on.

My biggest complaint is the placement and size of the air conditioning vents for the front and back seats. My second complaint was being told I could add the DVD player with that DVD screen in the head rest backs after I purchased it which I learned upon taking it to the dealership is not possible.  I feel like I was told this just to make the sale.

There is a shipping plastic'ish sticker that is attached to the windshield about 3/4 of the way down from the top of right side of the windshield. Even though this sticker is removed at the dealership and also "scraped" off with a razor blade, you can not see the sticker at all, until the sun hits the windshield right.  Then you can see what we are calling a "ghost sticker" that looks like a poorly attached cell phone screen protector.  Apparently there is no way to remove this "residue" and it will remain there for a long time to come.  Initially I thought it was an informational sticker actually imbedded inside the windshield for some reason until I talked to the dealer about it.    Improve where the center console storage box is located.  Perhaps relocate some sort of storage compartment or slot to the left side of the dash where there seems to be a decent space to put something.  Most vehicles have somewhere to at least rest your cell phone.      Also...my Murano came to my dealership without the subwoofer installed at the factory.  After driving my Murano for a few days, I could tell there was no bass in any of the songs.  Sure enough, no subwoofer was in the space of the spare tire.  When compared to another Murano SL that one had one, mine didn't.  The dealership resolved this issue immediately, but makes me wonder if there was anything else missing.
The ride is amazing.  The overall performance and comfort is to my liking.  All controls are easy to get to and easy to figure out.

Better fuel mileage (I know everyone wants better gas mileage).  Need altitude on GPS display (When I drive over mountain passes, I like to know how high I am).  Need better compass on GPS display.  Only one choice for light turn signal (three).  Need more choices of 4, 5, 6.  Need blind spot mirrors on the outside mirrors (standard).  Blind spot lights are a nice feature.  Could use crossing side lines beeper and display.  Cameras are great!  Should have the option to turn on rear camera without having to shift into reverse (so you can see the line when you pull into parking lot through first spot to second spot in front of it).

The starter button is in a horrible place.  It needs to be up by the steering wheel not by the gear shift.  We have accidentally pushed it and turned the car off while going down the road.  There was no way to turn it back on.  Very dangerous.  The instruction Manuel needs to be completely redone in a easier to understand format. The cell phone definately needs to be easier to operate and so does the navigation system.  Overall storage is not good.  Side pocket on doors are not deep enough.  Water bottles fall over and small Kleenex packets fall out.  The glove box needs to have an upper compartment with its on access and then the lower compartment.  You also need to be able to enter a destination on the navigation system while the car in in operation so the passenger could put in a restaurant or another destination.  We were not able to do that when traveling, so had to pull over, stop the car then enter a new one.  A huge pain!
The drive.  Transmission worked great in the mountains.  Love the styling.  Storage, manual and cell phone easy could definately be improved.
The navigation and cell phone issues are big ones. The amount of storage in the cargo space is small compared to my Toyota Rav.  Not getting as good of gas mileage as we hoped.

I have only driven this vehicle 1500 miles. This vehicle drives great (AWD) as expect the ride is a little on the firm side because of the AWD. There are only a few issues that I would comment on: the console area is very tight with space. If I have a USB cord plugged in and an additional cord for phone the cords are awkward. The door makes a really hollow noise when you open it and the handle retracts. This is more of a quality issue but makes the car "cheap" sounding and I bought a Murano that has possibly every option on it and this is a little annoying. There is also a "flapping" noise on the roof when I have driven on the freeway. I will have this checked at the dealership. I previously purchased (and still own) a Pathfinder and it had an issue with the roof racks so I am assuming this is also related to the roof racks.   Other than these minor issues I am very pleased with the car and have had many compliments on the looks of it. The Midnight Edition is a nice touch.

I really like the size of it. I downsized from a Pathfinder (that I passed on to my son with child) as I didn't need a 7 passenger vehicle any longer (I do miss the cargo space though).   The Apple Car Play is a great option. The style of the car is great. Looks great and I have the Midnight Edition that adds lots of character. The remote start and air conditioned seats are a must for me since I live in the south and a black on black car gets a little hot. The APP that allows me to remote start the car while I am in the grocery store is an added bonus. Drives really well and performs good.

I think that Nissan for the most part (I did have issues with my transmission in the Pathfinder, the transmission was replaced) builds a great looking and reliable product for a reasonable price point. This is the second new Nissan vehicle that I have purchased and have had no issues (other than the transmission) with them.
Back up camera, satellite radio
Gas mileage is just okay everything else is great.

The amber light that indicates another car to the side is too dim to see during bright sunshine (most days in South Florida).    Transmission seems to need another low gear, as it shifts noticeably at slow speeds.    Back up camera is useless when raining. Water covers the camera lens.    Undercarriage seems to have a low hanging bar towards the rear.

I am really satisfied with my Nissan Murano. The only thing missing that Nissan does not put on their cars are Automatic Dimming High Beam Headlights. This a feature I feel should be on all cars today. Most other manufacturers have this option and am surprised Nissan does not. Also, the USB port located inside of a small flip top compartment in front of the front Console is very difficult to access. There is not much room to maneuver the USB end wire into the port. The leather seat color choices could be improved. A darker tan color would be more practical than the yellowish Beige color. Cargo covers should not be an "Option" but included on all Muranos.

I like the following items the most on my new Murano Platinum:  Intelligent Cruise Control, 360 degree cameras around car, right side parking camera, the entire Navigation system with all of the Voice commands, the driver's information system options in the Odometer/Speedometer screen, the ability to turn on and off all of the safety features of the car, the Blind Side warning system, the classy and stylish exterior body design, the seats are out of this world comfortable, the heated and cooled seats, the Bose sound system, the memory steering wheel and seats positions, the self starting ignition and automatic front window roll down when approaching the vehicle from a distance, the quiet and smooth ride, the extended Moon Roof to the back seat, the plentiful room inside the cabin and cargo area and finally the good gas mileage for a 6 cylinder car.

The service department is supposed to call when the parts are in. That was 2.5 weeks ago & I haven't heard from them yet.  2. I repeatedly have an ABS & AWD warning lights activate upon braking & just received a recall notice which requires yet another trip to the service department.   I'm spending entirely too much time/gas/mileage trying to get this car in the shape it should have been upon delivery. I'm pretty disappointed. Three things. One, the console lid does not open completely vertically limiting access when driving. Two, the small compartment in front of the console should open away from the console, not towards it. I and the passenger are behind the open compartment and can not see inside it without leaning forward. Three, the interior dome lights are not adequate. Very dim. My previous cars could light up the inside and rear of the cars with no problems. Had I test driven this car at night, I may not have bought it. I traded in a 2015 Toyota Highlander Platinum for this car. It was a tough choice, and like I said, I may not have purchased this car for that reason. It's very irritating to have to pull out a flashlight to read written directions or anything else at night. Nissan needs to revisit these issues.

This is my second Murano in our household.  There were two recalls within weeks after purchase.  I took it in and the mechanics said I did not have the bad ABS sensor and the passenger seat airbag sensor was working.  Frankly, I can no know for a fact this is true.  It is a matter of trust.  I do NOT like looking at the yellow warning Air Bag 2 is off.  I drive without anyone in that seat ofter (my wife has the other car) and so the light stays on.  Guess I just have to accept that is necessary to see that the sensor is working.

The style, handling, and quiet ride.  Also, love the new amenities like the warnings of several types and the slow-down when in cruise control and the car ahead is too close.  The bose speakers are great and I LOVE the bluetooth capability.  Just get in the car and listen to my iPhone selections or iMusic.  Overall, this car is much more fun than the 2011 Murano. (Yet with usb I have helped my wife connect with her music.)  The 2016 is fun to drive.  Very smooth transmission.

This is my third Murano, and it took me a while to warm to the new styling. I'm very upset that within days of getting the vehicle there are several areas where it appears the paint is chipping. My last two Muranos were silver, this one is gun metal, so I don't know if that makes a difference in the paint. But I am less than pleased with the issues with the paint. Although the areas are small, I'm concerned about the current issues as well as what I'll see in the future if this continues. There are a couple of additional items I would ask NIssan to consider for future models. First is to add auto sensing windshield wipers and the Music box back into the vehicles - both features that I had in my 2012 Murano and miss greatly. Without these features I feel as if I went backward on my purchase somewhat. Another suggestion is to add in controls for the back seat heat/air so those in the back seat can control their comfort level. I do really enjoy my new Murano, but the paint issue and loss of a couple of my favorite features have made the purchase less than perfect.
It's a great vehicle - rides and handles nicely - and now that I've gotten used to the styling I really like the appearance.

More power! I love the looks, inside and out. But I am disappointed in the power.     My salesperson told me I had certain features, including rain sensing wipers and smart phone remote start. After much frustration trying to figure those out I returned to dealership to be told I don't have those.     We thought the Soundsystem just needed the settings changed, afterall, its the same Bose system my husband has in his car. Not the case, it's just got no sound quality.    Tires are not readily available. When traveling cross country on vacation we hit something in the road, causing the tire to be damaged beyond repair. No tire shop in Grants NM had one our size. Ok, it's a small town.  I called ahead to the Nissan dealerships in Albuquerque, they didn't have one either! 235 55 20. Thank god we didn't lose 2 tires like the guy in front of us.     I just reread the question. I would feel better if the sticky stuff on the paint were fixed and the black greasy stuff in the front window were fixed. I really would like to figure out a way to do the remote start on my phone. I don't know what could be done to fix the stereo and power issues. I would think they can do something to fix the headrests. I would love to have the Lane Departure feature for safety.

2016 Nissan Murano side view mirror reflection    I purchased a 2016 Gun Metallic Murano S AWD on the evening of May 31, 2016.  The next day when driving it I noticed strong reflections of the metallic silver plastic accent piece around the AC vents on the side mirrors.  This presents a significant safety hazard.  So far the dealership is taking the position that they have never heard of this issue.  On 6/1/2016, I spoke to the service manager (Janice) who stated that she had never heard of this problem.  I checked online and there are numerous customer complaints about this problem.  There are also many complaints regarding  this exact same problem for the 2015 model year.  I am very disappointed with the Abeloff Nissan dealership in Stroudsburg, Pennsylvania.     On 6/1/2016 I asked Janice to check the Nissan Muranos in the dealerships lot for this problem, and she said she would check, she did not call me back.  I also called Brian Yates (the car salesman) and Ian (the financial person) and they did not call me back either.

I am totally satisfied with the vehicle itself.  On the other hand, I am not pleased with the dealer from which I purchased this car.  I am due a refund on a 2015 Rogue unused portion of the extended warranty. I have received no help in recovering this refund.  I have contacted the Nissan customer care at 1-800-647-7261 and am getting help, slowly from them. But, the dealership, that sold me another extended warranty on my new 2016 Murano, has not done anything to help in the recovery of my unused portion of the 2015 Rogue warranty.  This makes me dissatisfied with the dealer and Nissan.  Unless this is resolved soon, (the Murano was purchased in June, it is now September) I will not consider another Nissan automobile.  I love the car, but where is the company when it comes to something like this.  I have to talk to someone in the Phillipean Islands, who is hard to understand.  You have to do better that that.  The dealership is in Lufkin, Texas.  It is Loving Nissan.

I'd like if the outside mirrors could fold in with a button instead of manually.  It would be great if headrests had an adjustment for back and forth.  It's tough for women who wear clips or a ponytail then we have to sit with our necks to the side of the headrest or with head at an angle that isn't great for proper driving.  The back window needs to be made bigger or higher at the top in order to allow a better view of traffic behind the car.  You can see the car immediately behind but the window cuts off traffic that is farther behind (if there is even a little hill) so it doesn't allow me to get out of the way for a large truck for example until they are directly behind.  Ideally I'd like to make the decision sooner but if we cut see that far back, its difficult.

Better quality control.  As mentioned, upon delivery, there was a minor paint flaw on the top which should have been detected upon inspection.  An additional item which hasn't been mentioned. Shortly after getting the vehicle, I heard a noise when pulling out of my garage that sounded like something hitting the floor. When I inspected the garage, I found a bolt ( with a torques head  ).  I showed this to the dealer and upon them inspecting the car, they informed me that it was from the driveshaft.  It appears the bolt as never completely screwed in.  These two items don't give me a good feeling regarding the quality control at Nissan.

Although the seats are supposed to be one of the high points for the Murano, they still feel about a comfortable as the seats that I had in my 2004 Quest.  They are comfortable, but not over the top.  It has a solid ride, but I'm still not sure about the CVT trans.  At times it feels a bit quirky, and only time will tell regarding its life.  I take very good care of my cars, and even the recently sold 2004 Quest was almost like new.  I don't put extensive mileage on my cars since I work from home, therefore, I'm expecting to have this auto for a long time unless poor engineering comes into play ( again, seeing how the CVT holds up ).  I had no issues with my 2004 quest aside from me replacing defective cam angle sensors ( Quest had approx 85k miles ) prior to selling it. Since the Murano has the same engine, I am comfortable with that fact and also the fact that I know the engine quite well due to the Quest.  It's only the new CVT that is a concern as I know this was a big issue on earlier models of the Murano.

(2) Both side windows in the back are too small to view approaching cars.  Even thought the car has blind spot detector, you will still want to peak back to be certain.  (3) When the car is in the lower speed, the blind spot detector does not work, which should be always working to detect approaching cars on both sides.  These are the three main drawback of Nissan Murano.

I love my murano, but there are two improvements I would make to bring the car up to Lexus standard:    1. Keep the general performance but improve in town gas mileage by at least 50%, and highway gas mileage by 25%.    2. The cabin is pretty quiet which was an absolute requirement for my SUV selection.  Even more insulation from road noise would be the real cherry on top!  I want to be able to have an easy conversation with rear seat passengers, even when driving over poor surfaces, and get out of the car after a journey without the slightest inkling of a headache caused by annoying transient noises    It is also too early to say if the the cars reliability puts it on a par with Lexus and some other Toyota brands.  My hope is that it will, and that it holds it's value over the years.  We shall see

Met with the Service Manager and Sales Associate. Apparently, the vibration/noise issue at 1000 RPM is something that Nissan is aware of and is the result of attempting fuel efficiency. The Service Manager knew exactly this issue and was very upfront, honest. Nissan opted for better fuel economy but which results in vibration and noise when in Drive/Automatic. Switching to Manual resolves the issue but there shouldn't have to be an issue to resolve.

I switched over to the Nissan Murano after 13 years and two 4Runners so I felt I was downsizing, but I have been pleased with the comfort and roominess of the Murano's interior.  I love the way it drives and handles on the highway.  It's a great car and I could not be more pleased with my choice.  There is nothing I would change about it other than a small item, being the small USB access compartment on the mid console.  You have to leave the small door open to use it which I don't like so I run my old coiled connector from the large console to charge my phone.  I find that small compartment pretty useless.
The style, color, interior is rich looking and well made.  I wanted a sporty looking SUV and the Murano was the best out there in its class.

I wanted the ability to haul things and have AWD for mountain passes in winter, so I chose the Murano.  I did not have these desired qualities in the Lexus.  And I did not want to spend the amount of money for the luxury high end SUV to get those qualities.  I am happy with my new Murano and it fits my budget.

However I must say that the recall with the brake actuator frightened me and  although it has now been fixed,  thanks to my wonderful service people at Brenner Nissan, i still  feel vulnerable  wondering if there will be some other serious recalls that I'm not aware of at this time and if I'm going to be left on the side of the road in a very busy and unsafe area when I drive to New York and to Georgia.  I am not real happy with the seatbelt issue that I described earlier  When I mentioned about storage space  I find the pockets on the doors are very shallow and I can't keep items there as I was able to do on my 2005 Nissan quest .  I also enjoy and love how the car handles and am enjoying the many safety features. I love to tell people about forward emergency braking and hill assist and the way the cruise control works. I think it would be better if I took this survey in six months or more but I've only had the car for a little over two months.

I'm sorry, I think I put many of these things in the last answer. As I mentioned there I love all the safety features. I love the looks and I love how the car handles. It's probably the last car I'm going to purchase and I'm very happy to be driving it in spite of the  issues that I mentioned before.  The service department at my dealer was wonderful and took appropriate and fast care of my car when the brake actuator situation, which was very dangerous and frightening, occurred. I told them and I will tell you the reason I bought another Nissan was because I knew the service department would take care of me when I needed it  I didn't think I would need them so soon but I did and they took care of the serious recall issue  quickly and efficiently.

Steering wheel: a sharp edge exists where the silver plastic meets the durable part of the spoke -- uncomfortable feel.   Lane Drift Warning: I assumed the car had this feature and was truly disappointed after buying the car and learning that it didn't.   Rear seat belts: often get hung in the back seat folding down, or interferes with fold down process.  Driver's seat belt: hides between seat and car frame, so difficult to reach. Better if moved forward of seat, so I could easily grab it.  Communications Package: very poor that iPhone 6 not always compatible, such as replying to texts. Google app outright sucks -- poor excuse for a feature. Where is Facebook -- not yet rolled out!  Sirius Traffic: does such a terrible job with traffic jams that I use Garmon, stuck to my windshield -- that's how bad Sirius does with rerouting when a traffic jam appears.  Center Console: Why, on main setting, would you give me the station name instead of the artist/song name? When using NAV, I constantly turn map off to see artist name -- shouldn't have to do this.  Center Console: Why turn off the compass when the NAV is on? I often want to know the direction I'm heading, despite what the NAV says to do.  Roof Crossbars: cause a wind should that didn't exist before. Couldn't you develop a more aerodynamic product?

Great looks -- "chiseled"!  Quite. Good sound system. Sophisticated feeling interior, with leather and silver.  Nice, tall center counsel with table-top -like function.   Big glove box. Big center counsel container. Decent storage room in doors.   Easy to access spare tire compartment, which means I can store flares, cables, flashlight, etc. there -- great compartment for extra storage, due to ease of accessibility.   Best feature: smart cruise control -- I've driven 6,000 miles in two months, and I use this feature all the time -- really saves on wear and tear (how tired I get) after long drives!

My complaint is the navigation system. EVERY time I have used it, it stops before the destination is arrived, with the automated voice saying due to road construction ahead, navigation is unable to continue. Please read a map." This is very irritating, because I don't travel with a map and have to find a place to pull off the road and try to use my GPS on my phone to guide me. It has NEVER failed to direct me, and each time the Nissan system said there was road construction, I NEVER saw any construction anywhere near my destination. If this is not a common complaint, please let me know because I travel a lot and need a reliable car navigation. Thank you.

The Murano has great acceleration and power, but the handling should be better since it is a Nissan.  It is too cushy, which leaves me less confident when driving. I had an Infiniti G35 for 10 years, so I guess I was expecting the steering and handling of the Murano to be pretty much on the same playing field.  I am sure that most female drivers would not have this complaint, however.   The seats are comfortable, but I believe the seats could be a couple of inches deeper so to extend thigh support for those of us that have long legs and long thighs.    The sound system could definitely have an upgrade.  It doesn't have the quality of bass and treble in the front that I was expecting. It is better in the rear.   Consider putting in a feature that allows the driver to fold in the outside mirrors electronically.  Also, I would add a blindspot monitor to the outside mirror as well as having the light on the inside.    It would be convenient for the passengers in the back to have the ability to control the airflow from the back AC vents.    A safety feature Nissan might consider is the lane departure warning system.

My Murano is a beautiful vehicle with avant garde styling. The blue paint has a glimmering sheen because of the sparkles/glitter mix. The wheels are unique and appealing.   The interior is very comfortable and the center console is big enough for me to put my purse inside, which keeps it off the front passenger seat!  (minor but very practical)  I really like theAWD and all of the safety features offered.  Overall, I am so pleased with this vehicle.  It is a Crossover SUV that handles better than most sedans but has the room I need to travel with my show dogs.
There is really nothing I would change.

Number one the driver seat rubs against the middle console the leather on leather it makes it annoying squeaking sound major flaw in the design you either need to push the seat more to the left on the driver side or make the middle console smaller or just make the vehicle wider as a whole.  Number two there is no place to put your cell phone there's a side pocket on either side of the driver side that's it hate it you need something for me to park my phone on.  Number 3 there is no way to play a DVD player on the screen? It has to go behind the seats? Not acceptable I want to be able to do whatever the heck I want with my car when I want I don't want just a CD player in the console I want that screen to be able to play DVDs and YouTube videos and go on Facebook and everything else I realize you guys have it probably not because of safety features but you have to trust us drivers that we're not going to drive while watching a DVD or Facebooking or you to me it also needs to connect two iPads through Bluetooth major flaw.  Number 4 I do like the silver interior but when the Sun hits it shines in my eyes it's too big of a reflective floor another reflective fly the angle on the front hood when the Sun hits it just right it blind you even though I have a black car it's still reflects and hits me in the eye the angle is wrong pointing towards the driver's eyes right in front of the windshield the first part of the metal Hood.  Number 5 Trunk space? There really isn't any why did you guys not give it more space without having to drop down the seats it's really annoying I want the car to be wider in the back and I also want it to be longer yes I realize I can get the Armada Platinum Edition but I really don't want to pay the V8 gas all I'm asking is for an extra two feet no big deal.  Number 6 The rear trunk when it's open I'm six foot one I hit my head constantly on that stupid trunk when it's fully engaged in the upright position I always forget I'm tall and I hit it every time I need the car to be a higher clearance on the trunk.  Number 7 There is a grinding noise going from 0 miles to 25 miles an hour when stopped at a red light doesn't matter if the car is cold or warm it feels like the front wheel drive works perfect the rear wheel drive takes a minute to kick in when it does it gives it a slight jerking sound it is annoying need to be fixed.  Number 8 I got the technology package with this vehicle and the rear behind the console only is a USB port? It doesn't trickle charge? I would like a 12 volt charge back there for my friends we don't need a trickle charge port USB it can be both you guys are smart figure it out. Move the 12 volt outlet away from the cup holders so it is more realistic to use. Adjust the cup holders to allow different sizes of bottles/cups that are not as standard.  This is very important for road trips that happen often.  Please change the door bottle holder to a proper upright position. It will make it easier to remove the bottle without having to take eyes off the road.  If you correct the position you could also add in a second bottle holder.  Again, very nice for long drives. A material that doesn't retain lint/hair would be nice for cleaning purposes.  Why the hell are there spaces underneath the back seats? Its annoying to try and clean under there when small children have the ability to stick crap ANYWHERE! They have skills that drive me mad. I now have a small action figure I can't get out. Offer the garage door opener on the visor or near the sunglasses on multiple models.  Not all of us need/want/can afford the most expensive model for these things.

Improve gas mileage.The ride could be a little softer. Road bumps and potholes are a bit jarring. Redesign the hood so that that bent part facing the driver/passenger isn't so prominent. Use a leather finish that does not attract dirt - it has an almost tacky feel to it. Please have a pocket that will fit plus sized phones on the console. Cup holders on console should be a bit larger, Will not fit an actual coffee cup. The sound system is just not that good - not rich enough and does not give a surround sound. NO amount of playing with the balance helps. Not sure how many speakers are in this model but I've heard better sound systems in cheaper cars. The NAVIGATION system is awful. Too many prompts to make a simple phone call. Navigation map design is very poor. Compare to WAZE or even Siri. The company Nissan is using is unacceptable.

This is my second murano.  While a lot of the enhancements I was looking for have been made with the new model design, there are three things I would suggest.  For the sun visors in the front seats, add an extender that slides out.  When the sun is beating down on the driver's side, the sun visor isn't long enough to cover the entire window.  It would be nice if the cargo cover would fold back like it did in the prior model (love the extra space in the cargo area).  And third, have brighter lights that turn on in the front area by the rearview mirror - they are pretty dim.

It's hard to narrow down one thing as I love my murano.  I like all the driver seat options, the # of programmable SXM stations, and the backup camera views.  I also like the protective warning notifications.
The only thing that I truly think needs work is the sound system.

We love our Murano.. 2nd purchase. I am disappointed that when we bought the car we were not alerted to the recall that could cause a fire... We would have waited but still purchased the car once you have the problem fixed. We first heard about the recall a few days after we purchased it... on the internet..    Our Sales professional was great... Steve. He was the best and we will go back to him... but Nissan knew of this problem and did not address this on the front end. If it were a small recall... well... but for us to have to worry about a fire and as now outlined by the mailing that we received... it could burn a house down if left in a garage... well... The car runs great and we are fans of Nissan... but the communications of this recall was not handled well.

I have researched this online and found that many people have issues with this and the Service Departments seem to think their is nothing they can do, so Nissan or whomever is the Manufacturer of the System should correct this issue. The weakest part of the vehicle's design is the lack of "cubby" spaces in and around the center console--I feel that area could be designed much better.  For example, I don't like how the USB port is buried INSIDE the console, and there is no cnvenient place to place my phone (the drink holder does not work well for this).  Another issue...and this is really minor, but....when you lock or unlock the vehicle via the key fob or exterior door handle button, like all other cars, it will "beep" once or twice. The question as a designer is should it beep twice when you lock it, or when you unlock it.  Unlike the Murano, it seems most other cars beep twice when you UNlock them . To me this makes more sense, because "unlock" or "open" have two syllables, while "lock" or "close" have one--this just makes more sense / is easier to remember (I told you it was minor!) .  I am surprised that the vehicle does not have speed-sensitive wipers (which pause at a stop).  Finally, I think the exterior design is exceptional, but the front grill, with the large Nissan logo looks as if it came off of a pickup truck.  I would try to refine that.
#1--The exterior appearance.  #2--The interior design, with the exception of the center console.  #3--The vehicle size is just right...not too big / small.

It's a beautiful, comfortable car and it is elegant and fun.  But, there are some quirks--I have to raise the seat up practically touching the steering wheel to see over the hood and not hit concrete islands on the sides or which are in front.  The seat belt cuts into my neck because there is not adjustment for a short person (5'1").  And I have to scoot forward to put on the brake to then push the starter for the car, but when I do that the seat goes backward and takes my foot off the pedal.  That is most annoying.  Then I have to push it forward again (either manually or with the seat set device).  And I had to take off the head rests in the back seat so I could see (what little I could) out the back window.  Because, unless I have the car in reverse, I cannot see everything in the camera.

The interior layout and instrumentation/technology is beautifully laid out and a huge improvement over my 2012 Murano Platinum. Love the extra 2" in length and 1.5" in width. Handling is great and the zero gravity seats and "just right" seat bolsters continue to set Nissan apart from any competition.  Especially the BMW, Audi, and Mercedes manufacturers who seem to think we need hard seats with bolters that cut into your thighs.  With your many improvements you had to scrimp on front/back storage compartments.  The depth on sides of doors to store maps or other things isn't deep enough to hold much of anything.  The back seating drawer that was part of console in my 2012 Murano disappeared to make room for heating controls.  What I stored in that drawer had to be located in other storage area of vehicle.

Handling, ease in using technology and it's layout and finger touch ability. Quieter. Driver view of instrumentation directly in front of drive as part of DIC varieties. Better MPG. Love the cruise limit setting (by distance in feet) that automatically slows vehicle down when I get too close to vehicle in front of me. Pus the crash avoidance.

We're very happy with our purchase.  We were very well attended to by the Nissan dealership and were given a good deal on the chosen vehicle. We have had no problems with the vehicle and enjoy it when driving.
Looks - it looks really contemporary and yet is very comfortable inside.  The interior fit and finish is quite good and the vehicle drives and rides beautifully.

very proud to own this Murano - just 2 small notes to tell you about:  1) the sun visor is not cut properly on both driver and passenger sides, does not fully block out the sun; 2) driver seat is moulded a bit high so that the driver's thigh does not sit properly on the seat.  after longer periods of driving, it is noticeable.  It seems it was made for a thinner driver.  Other than these little notes, the vehicle is AWESOME - I would buy it again even with these issues.
sporty look, sporty sound of engine, good acceleration power

The CVT transmission slows the performance of the vehicle.  I have had other Nissan/Infiniti vehicles with 3.5 and 3.7 engines and the power delivery is much better.  In instances where I need to accelerate quickly it lacks.  Very disappointed with the fuel economy.  It is about the exactly same as my RAM 1500 5.7 Hemi engine (16.8 mpg mixed driving in cold weather).  For a 3.5 and this little weight I expected low 20's for mixed driving.  The interior is nice and easy to drive and operate - the lack of an integrated garage door opener is really odd for a 35K car.  I had to search my junk drawer for the old openers again and replace the batteries - it's been that long since I had a car that didn't have an integrated opener.  Seems like small potatoes to add it as standard.

Ride is solid - no squeaks or rattles -  this is very very important to me.  Easy to take on extended highway driving - comfortable.  The navigation is one of the BEST I have ever used - as well as the information systems (weather, gas, sports).  These are very well done.

Provide a lighter brown, i.e., saddle brown colored interior. The beige interior is almost white (including the steering wheel!!!) and all other interiors are close to black. The fuel economy has been below the advertised 21-27 mpg.  For me the overall average city/highway has been about 17.3 mpg. This has been a big unexpected disappointment to me.  And has cost me more in gas money than I expected. And, more frequent visits to the gas station than I expected.        The road visibility should be improved for both front and rear.     The sound system doesn't allow forward/backward when playing a song.  For example it doesn't let you go to a point in the middle of the song.   Also, I have had problems a few times, when playing music using USB1 drive. It wouldn't read the drive.  No issues yet with USB2.  The sound system has dropped Bluetooth connection a few times or had problems connecting to Bluetooth.     The sides mirror didn't go to the preset positions after a backup last week so I had to reposition them manually (using the setting controls).    If you raise the driver seat, the rear view mirror doesn't bend upward enough to have a good rear view.     Since car cameras are getting very popular, it might be a good idea to have a USB charger on the rear view mirror so if one is using a car camera, the camera can be connected to USB charger on the mirror so there won't a be USB cable running from the camera on the rear view mirror to USB charger on the console.

I like the exterior and interior looks of the car.  The ride is comfortable.  The interior is relatively quiet.  The sound of the sound system is clear and powerful. Having a second USB2 in the rear is convenient. The seat heaters have come very handy so far.
I am used to a faster start when accelerating.  Once I get to 50 mph it picks up power.

The rear of the hood ( next to the windshield) has a reverse angle that concentrates the sun's rays right into the driver's eyes.  Two hours on both sides of noon is when the blinding effect is most dangerous.  Shortly after I took delivery I went the the dealership and asked the dealer to put something on the reverse part of the hood so as to defuse the sun's rays. The dealer put some of the clear plastic stuff on that is typically used for the anti pebble nicks you apply on the front of the hood.  It did some good and I think it is enough of diffusion so the rays will not burn a person's eyes. The engineers created a design flaw that I noticed is also on the 2017 hood.  Unless one wears sun glasses, which I don't, and shouldn't have to, to eliminate the hazard, I think you have a dangerous situation.  The glare is enough to blind the driver in the event of traffic either crossing in front or straying into the driver's lane and he being able to take evasive action.

It's a great mid size SUV.  Can't get anywhere near advertised mileage, though.  At best, 21 MPG.  Interior mother of pearl trim pretty, but margins not very good.  Gaps on dash.The usb port in the front console is almost unusable as it's so difficult to reach. The hood latch is about a 3 on a scale of 1-10.  Not intuitive and doesn't work well.  I'd manufacture this vehicle with smaller wheels to improve ride.  Software on Sirius weather poor versus other vehicles.  You can't reduce range and get any fidelity on cloud picture.  Turns into square blobs.  Use of Command touch screen Excellent.  Sound system odd.  Seems to be front centered and unable to adjust balance more rearward.  Interior colors and comfort of seats - Outstanding.  Voice recognition for commands barely average.  65% of time it gets it wrong.  Exterior design Lines of vehicle - outstanding. Some flimsy plastics on rear bumper and lower wheel cover and same for front grill.   Would suggest that the blind spot warning light occupy the whole side trim mount.  It's too small as designed.  Could be doubled or tripled in height for better alerting.

Overall Exterior and interior design lines are outstanding.  Interior trim outstanding except for mother of pearl plastic accents.  Margins aren't too good, there.  Seats are outstanding.  Console design - outstanding except for USB port.  Middle of console one almost unusable it's so difficult to get to.  Back storage outstanding.

There are two things that need attention:  1) blindspots, though we have the light and sound alert for vehicles next the Murano, I would suggest that you add a "fish eye" to the lower outside corner of the exterior mirrors, this would give the driver just a bit more assurance.  2) glare off the hood, the hood nears the windshield has a downturned area which at times when the sun's reflection blinds the driver and passenger.  Would suggest either keeping the hood line straight back to windshield area or the use of some non-glare material on the downturned area that would resist reflection.    My dissappointment is not with the vehicle but with Nissan Finance.  Even with the selected option of notification for payments which worked, in fact still is active (received payment alert) even though I have paid the off the loan.  I could no longer access the history or the loan information after sending the pay off payment (had not received any information of receipt of payment).  Nor did I get any notice by email or mail that the loan had been paid until I recieved the title reflecting the lien had been "canceled".  I called the Nissan Finance phone number and seemed that I was dealing with a person that did not understand my need for receiving timely communication nor open to receive any suggestions on dealing with customers.  Hope that you can communicate these concerns to those in the Nissan Fiance area.

Vaden Nissan of Hilton Head was a disappointing purchasing experience to say the least.  I have never been treated so poorly (especially when purchasing a big ticket product)!  The only person that was professional was our sales person, Melissa Gardner.  She went above and beyond to help us with very minimal support from the Vaden staff.  As for the finance, insurance, sales management departments, etc, I cannot give a good review.  The General Sales Manager, John, left an open-ended conversation by not returning a call. He was looking to help minimize some of the costs ... Like they sold me a package (wheel locks, floor matts, an emergency kit, tinted windows) for just under $2000 that I did not want.  I asked that it all be removed except for the tinting (which would have been hard for them to do and of which I would have paid for) to no avail. If I was going to spend more money, I would have purchased an extended warranty!  I was trying to keep my payment down. I didn't need those extras or even want them.  All of the problems that we had with them are too numerous to put in this review.  I do know, however, that I will not be recommending anyone to Vaden Nissan. I am so disappointed with them.  The purchasing experience could have been much better.  I have owned a Pathfinder and Xterra.  I LOVE Nissan products and ultimately, my Murano!!  That is the only reason along with dealership and Nissan incentives that I went to Vaden.

I love the new 2016 Murano.  It is my second Murano, having purchased a new one in 2009. The gas mileage is better than the 2009 model, but could still be improved.  It is a 6 cylinder engine, which I enjoy for the the power and handling, and I realize that it has limitations on mileage. I am disappointed that the cargo organizer is no longer integrated into the trunk as in the 2009 model. It was only available on the Pathfinder.  I used this every day and I am not happy that it was not put into this model. I had to purchase a cargo net to keep groceries from sliding all over. I also had to purchase a Weather tech cargo liner to protect the carpet.  My 2009 came with a protector.

Comfort and looks

Aim for better sitting posture with ability to sit with legs/thighs at right angles, and enough head room or space between my head and the roof/ceiling with my seat at the highest position.  Make it easier to interpret/understand/comprehend the around-view monitor.  Forward/backward adjustments for head restraints.  Warmer seats while car is idling or remotely warming up so I sit on warm seats when entering Murano in cold winter weather.  Have less obstructed views in the front and rear sides of the vehicles.  Don't have the seats angled on the sides. They press into my left thigh. (I'm a thin/average person.)  The metal portion on the steering wheel has rough edges; make that outer edge smooth or tapered so it doesn't cut/scrape a person's hand.  Have adjustable arm rests that can be placed close to the person. (My physical therapist says I should be using a chair with arm rests.)

I like the unique design and color (Pacific Sunset), different shape/design/look than the typical look of the other SUVs; the others look similar, but Murano has its unique design with its windows, etc. I also like the unique color of Pacific Sunset, just the right shade/tint; I see other similar colors but they're not quite right or I don't like them. I also like the interior design/colors with cashmere leather. In test-driving and comparing the Murano with other SUVs before making a purchase, the Murano seemed quieter and smoother than others. With my hearing impairment, it's important to me to have a "quiet" vehicle so I can hear my passenger better. I also like the Around View feature with the SL trim; it would have cost me much more if I got it in another SUV. I also like the luxurious look/feel of the Murano.

Provide a storage tray in the rear compartment such as with the 2007 model. Utilize the space under the rear seats for storage. Door pockets are too small. The eyeglass holder is too small. Have an option for a turbocharger or supercharger. Have an option for an upgrade to the sound system (surround sound, mega bass, more power). Colored interior accent lighting.
Very sleek and sexy looking. Love the intelligent cruise and other driver assistance features. Very comfortable.

I love my Murano, it was the only car I wanted and I was very happy that the dealership right across the street from where I live had the exact model I wanted in stock.     My issue is that I purchased it on 1/26/17 from Mt Kisco Nissan in Mt Kisco, NY and one week later the dealership closed. My paperwork has been caught up in legal action and I have spent way too much time trying to get my car officially registered and legal ownership of the car.     A time of purchase the dealership offered me 3 years of maintenance (oil changes and tire rotation). According to Nissan, it is up to the new dealership I go to for service to determine whether or not they will honor this. (1) Nissan should cover this and (2) it should not be up to me to cut deals with a new dealership.    Nissan knew that this dealership was closing, I am sure that there are many moving pieces, but there should have been some indication that anyone who purchased a car during this period would have issues. It would have been nice to have been contacted by Nissan with next steps and how to proceed to legally drive my new car. I learned from a neighbor and spent days trying to piece it together between contacting White Plains Nissan, contacting DMV and Nissan.  Nissan was not able to do much, I had to handle everything with the DMV and have been working with their complaint department and an inspector. Once my paperwork is processed through the DMV, I will also need to pay for my registration again and I have received no indication on when I will be reimbursed.    I did speak with Nissan weeks ago and never received a follow-up call to see if all is OK. That is unacceptable.    I love my car, but I am very unhappy with the way that this situation was handled. This purchase is a big investment and something I worked hard towards.     If you have any questions or need additional information, I can be reached at 914-666-2051.    Donna Cravotta

It is really not the dealership's fault, but my Murano has never been detailed.  It was not done the day I was supposed to pick it up due to weather.  It has not been done since.  I have noticed scuffs on a couple of the handles and the back with very minimal use.  I have purchased many autos over the years, but this is my first Nissan.  While I like the vehicle very much, I doubt the dealership will ever detail or correct the scuffs since I took delivery without a detail service.  I will never do that again, and their response will determine if I will purchase Nissan again or not.  While the scuffs take nothing away from the driving dynamics, they and the plastic and stickers that I continually try to remove from the Murano are annoying.

Overall, I love the Murano, and if something happened to this one today, I would get another tomorrow. However, I have 3 general complaints:  - I wish the exterior paint had more layers of clear coat. I've never had a vehicle whose exterior scratched or chipped so easily, and my previous vehicle was black too.  - I wish the seat warmers heated up faster. I miss my previous vehicle's seat warmers that were toasting within a minute, which kept me warm while the heater warmed up.  - I wish the engine/transmission could crawl slower in stop-and-go traffic. The "crawl" speed (i.e. no pedal interaction) is fairly fast, and I have to hit the brakes often in accident traffic, and it's obnoxious.    Otherwise, I love the Murano.

I have 2 design suggestions.  The back window is a collector of dirt.  The design needs to be changed.  After a car wash it is the first place to quickly be dirty again.  Pollen, dust, etc just seems to noticably collect on the rear window.  I own two Nissan Murano Platinum cars (2015 and 2016) and this is a  problem with both.  The second thing going that should be changed is at the base of the driver'side seat  there is a plastic cosmetic trim piece that will scratch or scrape your left leg when you wear shorts.  It is not noticeable if you are wearing long pants.  Have scraped my leg several times when shifting my left leg position.  The piece of plastic sticks   forward too far and the bottom edge of the plastic is sharp.  Again, this is on both of my cars.
